text:
System.Access: Granted
Welcome, Agent.
Your first task is to bypass the security layer.

> Decode the password: [ HACKTIV8 ]

Layer 1 Bypassed. Good.
Now, decrypt the communication frequency.
It's not a programming language, but it's the web's primary language for visual presentation and styling.

> Identify the technology: [ _ _ _ ]

Frequency Decrypted. Impressive.
To gain full access, name the core technology that allows for interactive, component-based UIs.

> Identify the library: [ R_ _ _ _ ]

Mainframe connection established.
Every good agent saves their progress. What two-word command saves your changes with a message in version control?

> Enter command: [ g__ ______ ]

Firewall is adapting. Quick!
Data is being transmitted in a lightweight format based on JavaScript Object Notation.

> What is the common 4-letter acronym for this format? [ _ _ _ _ ]

They are trying to trace you!
They've set up a logic trap. Find the next number in this famous sequence.

1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, [ __ ]

Trace failed. You are a ghost.
Now, exploit their database. What is the name of the common attack that uses malicious code to manipulate a backend database?

> Identify the attack vector: [ S__ _________ ]

Database breached. We need their core data.
In React, what 'Hook' is used to manage a component's internal state?

> Name the hook: [ u__S____ ]

Almost there, Agent!
To disable their external defenses, you must understand how their systems communicate. What does the 'P' stand for in 'HTTP'?

> Identify the term: [ P_______ ]

CORE ACCESS ACHIEVED.
They know we are here. There is only one thing left to do.
Execute the final command to disable the system safely.

> Final command: [ shutdown -h now ]
